entry.p: CPHY configuration routing recommendation
Recommend each CPHY port to be routed on the same layer.
Common mode choke (CMC)
Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor. CMC not accounted for in PDG.
Trio length matching
125 um for each trio; 1 mm between trios of a port
Trio routing arrangement
All trios should be routed as A-B-C or C-B-A
Referencing consideration
No routing over split planes allowed, or routing over noisy power planes. Only routing over solid planes are permissible. MIPI CSI CPHY signals should be treated as single ended nets.
Via placement

Via placement must be uniform within a trio to enable unform routing and transition. During each via transition, it is imperative that return vias are placed symmetrically close to the data vias. Ensure minimal routing imbalances when traces are routed in/out from the via to reduce impedance imbalance i.e uniformity of spacing between wire A,B and C.
CSI port use preference
If some of the CSI ports are not used, it must have CSI_A as one of the used ports.
Loss numbers
1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.42dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz
2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz

3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz.
Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used.

(Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
Reference plane
Microstrip: Full Ground reference

Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
PCB and Cable length restriction
For both PCB and Cables, length can be 20%-80% of maximum length unless specified otherwise. This guideline doesn't apply in case cable is absent.
